column4: From the Desktop CD installer for Jaunty, what do I need to do to reinstall the operating system without affecting /dev/sda6 where I have my home folder?

From the Desktop CD installer for Jaunty, what do I need to do to reinstall the operating system without affecting /dev/sda6 where I have my home folder? I'm at the "Prepare Partitions" screen now, so would really appreciate some quick help.
what are you trying to do?
I'm trying to reinstall Jaunty without having to re-import all my files. I have /home on its own partition, so that should be simple, right?
sorry, without having to re-import all my personal files
you can backup your /home directory somewhere
I don't have to do that if /home is on its own partition, do I?
reinstall the system and backup the /home directory
can you post fdisk -l ?

I can see the three partitions I made when I originally installed the system: /dev/sda1, /dev/sda5 (swap), and /dev/sda6 (where /home is). What I want to know is how to install the operating system without formatting /dev/sda6.
I don't know how to run a command from where I am right now on an install screen.
from Application>Accessories>Terminal
sudo fdisk -l
you can delete the /dev/sda6 partition

I don't really want to stop in the middle of the installation. Did you read what I posted before? I'm booted into the desktop cd, at the Prepare Partitions screen in the graphical installer. I would have to reboot to do something on my desktop and I don't even know if that's safe.
That would delete my home folder right?
yes
if you select a partition as / (root) than it will contain the /home directory ,why do you want to create seperate /home directory in making another partition ?

I don't understand why you keep telling me that then. I said I want an explanation of how to reinstall WITHOUT deleting my home folder. Please don't offer advice on how to do something I'm not trying to do.
i think you are creating needless extra /home directory in /dev/sda6
if you select a partition as root ("/ ") then it will automatically contain the /home directory

I put home on a separate partition precisely so I wouldn't have to import my data again if I reinstalled. Now I'm ready to reinstall and I'm not sure how to do that while leaving /dev/sda6 intact. could you just explain what I want to know instead of telling me what I'm doing is needless?
From the Desktop CD installer for Jaunty, what do I need to do to reinstall the operating system without affecting /dev/sda6 where I have my home folder?
well, i think  if you reinstall you will lose all data of your /home directory
